alert.note: Alert for Mobile; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 2:18PM CDT until April 15 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR MOBILE...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...GEORGE AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 217 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Deer Park to 6 miles west of Wilmer to 6 miles west of Vancleave, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Saraland, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Citronelle, Lucedale, Creola, Leakesville, Chunchula, Gulfcrest, Deer Park, Axis, Calvert, Mount Vernon, Semmes, Tanner Williams, I65 And I165 and Mobile Regional Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
